data: OB Cesarean Section - Pre Operative (Multiphase) EKM
Notify most responsible physician and primary care provider if rupture of membranes and/or labour appears to be progressing
once, prior to transfer to the operating room
Fetal heart auscultation within 1 hour pre-op or prior to transfer to the operating room and after regional anesthetics
Insert large bore IV, # 18 gauge preferred
Insert 2nd large bore IV, # 18 gauge preferred
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 80 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 80 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 80 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
150 mg, PO, 60 min pre-op, drug form: tab
10 mg, PO, 60 min pre-op, drug form: tab
10 mg, IV, 30 min pre-op, drug form: inj
For emergency cesarean section in labour
50 mg, IV, once, first dose: STAT
10 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
sodium citrate-citric acid 100-66.8 mg/mL oral liq
30 mL, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose: STAT

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
2,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag
3,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag

Select CBC and Differential & Group and Screen ONLY for urgent/emergent C-Sections if not already done.  For elective C-section pre-operative bloodwork orders, use outpatient orders in the OB Quick Orders tab
Nurse to NOT DISCONTINUE this phase please
For Rh negative / unknown patients, ensure the RhIG eligibility orders are selected
Collect Cord Blood Sample at Delivery and Place Order for Rh Testing
Collect cord blood sample at delivery and place order for “RBC Neonatal Investigation” in newborn chart
Nurse to Order Lab Collection of Maternal Blood for RhIg Eligibility Testing
Nurse to place order for “RBC Maternal Investigation” in maternal chart for RhIG Eligibility, at least one hour after delivery of placenta
If patient is eligible for RhIG (as per laboratory comment for maternal investigation), then order and then administer 1500 IU (300 ug), Routine, IM, Administer over: Not Applicable, T;N
Arterial Cord Blood Gas Baby A
Arterial Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Venous Cord Blood Gas Baby A
Venous Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Order a second set of cord blood gases for twin delivery
Arterial Cord Blood Gas Baby B
Arterial Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Venous Cord Blood Gas Baby B
Venous Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Order a third set of cord blood gases for triplet delivery
Arterial Cord Blood Gas Baby C
Arterial Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Venous Cord Blood Gas Baby C
Venous Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
